A division of Tenth Revolution Group, Frank Recruitment Group is a specialist technology recruitment business operating from 24 offices across North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific.

description_cie: As a key global player in fermentation, Lesaffre has been cultivating living organisms for more than 170 years, exploring and revealing the infinite potential of fermentation and micro-organisms every day. Our 11,000 employees on 5 continents work together with our customers, partners, and researchers to find ever more relevant answers to the needs of nutrition, health, naturalness, and respect for the environment. At all levels of the Group, one mission guides us in our daily actions: Working together to better nourish and protect the planet.
description_job: Lesaffre Digital & Data ambitions¬† Lesaffre‚Äôs Digital & Data journey started some years‚Äô ago with a strong push to encourage and cross-fertilize initiatives across the organization. Business impact of some of these first actions (Sales efficiency tools, My Lesaffre App for Bakers, digitalization of key operations etc‚Ä¶) have confirmed the importance of accelerating this journey.Digital & Data are to become a fundamental transformative force for Lesaffre growth. On one hand, as a lever to increase customer centricity and user experience. On the other, to bring operational excellence across the company.More concretely, some of these opportunities are:¬†Further empower salesforce & leverage digital marketing to capture, convert and keep our future and current clients and consumers¬†¬†Leverage omnichannel strategies to sell, serve and delight our customersTurn our industrial operations even more intelligent and efficient (digitalization of processes, automatization of low added value tasks, industrial productivity, supply chain performance ‚Ä¶)Contribute to unlocking further value and efficiency on R&D processesEmpowering transversal functions to deliver better user experiencesTo accelerate this journey, a substantial additional effort is being put in place. The recent arrival of a Chief Digital & Data Officer (ExCom member) has marked the beginning of this acceleration. With a more structured and results oriented journey, CD&D officer is creating a new organisation. Data and Tech is at the heart of the transformation. A Data and Tech Factory has been created to valorise Lesaffre‚Äôs data assets, and deliver use cases, governance capacities, and innovation. Both embedded in the Business and at a Global level, digital & data talents will be crucial to this transformative journey both in the impact to business as well as the development of D&D capabilities.In this context, Lesaffre is recruiting a Master Data Management Architect Job position:¬† This position is reporting to the Head of Data Governance and Quality within the Data&Tech Factory.The MDM Architect is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the master data management architecture to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and security of master data across the organization. This role requires a deep understanding of data governance, data quality, and data integration practices, as well as the ability to collaborate effectively with IT and business stakeholders to support data-driven decision-making processes.She/he will have the following responsibilities:¬†¬†MDM Architecture Design and ImplementationDevelop and maintain the MDM architecture to support business objectives and data governance standards.Design data models, hierarchies, taxonomies, and workflows to support effective data management and governance.Define data integration processes to ensure seamless data flow and integration across systems. Provide expertise in API integration, ETL processes to facilitate MDM implementation.Select and implement MDM tools and technologies that meet the organization‚Äôs needs.Master Data Management GovernanceDefine and manage master data governance processes, including data stewardship, data classification, and access controls.Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of master data across all systems.Implement and monitor data quality metrics and KPIs.Collaboration and Stakeholder EngagementWork closely with IT and business units to ensure effective implementation and adoption of MDM solutions.Facilitate communication and coordination among stakeholders to support data governance and quality initiatives.Provide technical leadership and guidance on MDM-related projects and activities.Technology and Tools ManagementEvaluate and recommend MDM tools and technologies to support the MDM architecture.Oversee the implementation, configuration, and maintenance of MDM tools.Ensure that MDM tools and processes are aligned with the organization‚Äôs data governance and quality standards. --- There is no such thing as a ‚Äòperfect‚Äô candidate. Lesaffre is a place where you can grow and in which whatever background you come with will be a plus. If you feel excited about the position, we strongly encourage you to apply even if you meet only two third the requirements.Master's degree in Data Management, Information Systems, or a related field5 to 10 years of experience, in similar roles (ideally in a global organization with a local-first approach)¬†Demonstrated experience in collaborating with IT stakeholders and cross-functional teams on master data management projects.Technical and professional skills:Strong SQL skills for data querying, manipulation, and reporting.Experience with data quality assessment, data cleansing, normalization, and enrichment techniques.Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.Knowledge of data modeling concepts and practices.Soft skills and competencies:Good communication skills , ability to prepare clear and concise reports and presentations.Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams, data stewards, and business units.Analytical skills to identify data quality issues, root causes, and implement corrective actions.Commitment to maintaining high standards of data quality.Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, prioritizing work effectively to meet deadlines.

description_job: Want to join a fast-moving company, work among convivial teams and take part in the global growth strategy of one of the most prestigious and comprehensive portfolios in the wine & spirits industry? We are looking for our Data Analyst! You will be based at The Island, our office in central Paris.We‚Äôre looking for a passionate and talented Data Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. In this role, you‚Äôll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data analytics methods in the domain of Data Science to sustain Pernod-Ricard growth.Your roleIn this role, as a data analyst for one of our Key Digital Programs, you will help business stakeholders achieve their goals by leveraging data to deliver strategic recommendations and automated data analysis solutions.You will integrate the Data, Design and Analytics team where various profiles work together (Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Machine Learning Engineer, Design team, Data Office team).Your responsibilitiesYour responsibilities to support the KDP lifecycle, you will :Conduct data exploration activities to effectively frame and extend the scope of data analysis projects.Prepare and clean data for analysis, including data quality, normalization and transformation as needed.Develop intuitive interfaces and dashboards for visualizing and presenting data insights.Conduct recurring and ad hoc analysis to provide valuable insights for decision-making.Program and monitor business value, including tracking adoption rates, calculating impact, and monitoring key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of our data programs.How do you drive results?You consistently drive results by proactively setting challenging goals, planning and organizing tasks effectively, and taking ownership of outcomes.You demonstrate a strong work ethic and contribute significantly to achieving team objectives.You are responsible for making the actions identified as a priority, a reality.How do you drive engagement?From the quality of your work, you consistently drive engagement by actively contributing to team initiatives, generating innovative ideas, and encouraging open communication. You proactively seek opportunities to motivate and inspire team members.When complex or unclear topics are expected to be delivered by the team, you are able to suggest & engage teams and counterparts on tangible resolution paths. --- If you recognize yourself in the description below, don‚Äôt wait to apply!¬†You have a masters diploma (or equivalent) in Engineering, Business, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.You have about 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or business analyst. Experience in FMCG Company or data consulting is a plus.Your Soft skillsYou have very good oral and written communication skills,You are a natural team player, with strong collaboration skills,You have an entrepreneurial mindset,You are result-oriented, curious, self-learner and autonomous,You have a high proactivity in identifying problems and offering solutions.‚ÄãYour Hard skillsYou have a well-developed business acumen, aware about the value data brings to Pernod Ricard,You have an advanced level in Excel and SQL. Experience with DBT is a plus.You have an advanced level in Python panda library and visualization packages,You are experimented with an automated data visualization solution, Power BI is a strong plus,You are fluent in English, French is a plus,You understand data circulation & data architecture principles.Wait, there‚Äôs more‚Ä¶Working at Pernod Ricard is the perfect place for you to develop your analytical skills in a holistic way:We use Agile ways of working, allowing you to work in multidisciplinary teams deeply integrated with business and market. You will develop both technical skills and business / soft skills.Work with many different teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts, MLE, Business teams etc..) for a 100% international scopeWe offer you an outstanding and collaborative workplace that embodies our sharing & conviviality culture, the possibility to work from home (2 days a week), a very complete mutual insurance, an attractive compensation including profit-sharing, the possibility to train daily, employee events‚Ä¶Pernod Ricard values diversity and solidarity within its organization and in its relations with stakeholders. Our recruitment methods focus on skills, and we welcome all types of talents.

You will be instrumental in ensuring our product team can track performance, report to executives and investors, co-construct data features, and maintain high data quality across our offerings. analytics.Stay updated with the latest data trends and technologies to innovate and improve our data capabilities.Data VisionWork closely with the Chief Product Officer (CPO) to co-build and execute the analytics vision of our offeringInfluence and contribute to the strategic direction of United Heroes through data insights and foresight.Data Models Management OwnershipConstruct, manage, update, and optimize various data models to ensure data quality and integrity.Collaborate with the CTO on data engineering tasks and ensure seamless data flow across systems.Utilize SQL, Python, and other tools to manage data pipelines and databases efficiently.Foster a data-driven culture within Sport HeroesAdvocate for data-driven decision-making across the organization.Align stakeholders on the translate into practical outcomes.

description_cie: Stago is a French company in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry with international activities. With operations in 18 countries, it has nearly 2,600 employees, half of whom are based out of France.Stago is an independent, privately-owned company that brings together all skills and know-how in the field of biology and instrumentation to develop, manufacture and market the widest range of reagents and instruments for hemostasis analysis throughout the world.Using the most advanced computer, electronic and biological technologies, Stago invests in research and innovation to develop ever more effective reagents, instruments and diagnostic solutions.With more than 350 products on the market, Stago is a world leader in In Vitro Diagnostics and a preferred partner of medical laboratories.Customer satisfaction is a strong value and everyone is aware that behind their actions there is a patient.

description_cie: Founded in 2016 by two French entrepreneurs, Treezor quickly gained prominence in the financial sector before being acquired in 2019 by the Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale group.Treezor positions itself as an Electronic Money Institution, approved by the ACPR, allowing it to operate in no fewer than 25 countries while being a key player in the Mastercard network.Treezor played a pioneering role in the development of the ‚ÄúBanking as a Service‚Äù model and has now achieved the status of the undisputed European leader, expanding its presence to five major countries: Germany, Belgium, Spain, Italy, and, of course, France.Our mission is to support innovative projects by integrating a comprehensive range of payment services. Would you like to give meaning to your professional activity?Do you feel the need to be useful?Would you like to help the planet and work towards a better and more sustainable future?Do you have a ‚ÄúResourcer‚Äù spirit?‚Ä¶. At Veolia, 84% of employees and 92% of managers feel invested in their job*. Teams find meaning and purpose in their work in the water, energy or waste management.At Veolia, we recruit several hundred young graduates every year, from engineering or business schools and universities. They join us for either an internship, a work-study contract or their first job. We also offer them V.I.E. contracts (international voluntary programs in companies) through our dedicated Pangeo program.Through our Campus network, we also take on trainees, supporting them from CAP-level (certificate of professional aptitude) to a master‚Äôs degree.At Veolia, our 178,894 employees share a mission: resourcing the world. This is why we call them ‚ÄúResourcers‚Äù.We all work together towards Veolia‚Äôs ambition: to be the benchmark company for ecological transformation.Operating in 51 countries on five continents, with more than 178,894 employees, Veolia designs and implements solutions that contribute to sustainable development in cities and industries, in the fields of water, waste and energy management. Specialized in environmental services, Veolia is committed every day, on every continent, to improving access to resources, while preserving and replenish them.The Group ensures that international laws and treaties guaranteeing the human and social rights of all people are strictly observed, both within the company and by its stakeholders. These values and rules of conduct take the cultural diversity of the Group into account.In 2020, Veolia supplied 95 million people with drinking water and 62 million people with wastewater services, produced almost 43 million megawatt hours of energy and recovered 47 million metric tons of waste.

description_job: As Data Team Lead, you will be the driving force behind our data-driven decision-making processes. You will lead, mentor, and inspire a team of talented data professionals, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment. description_cie: Wakam is a European B2B2C insurer that designs white-label insurance products for its partners (e-retailers, brokers and fintech/insurtech, etc.). Since March 2021, we are a Mission-driven company, which means that our mission statement ‚ÄòEnabling transparent and impactful insurance‚Äô is written in our bylaws. And we go further: by defining concrete commitments to illustrate this mission, such as writing our insurance contracts in plain language (no more confusing terms and conditions). We also create insurance products at cost for associations. Our culture? Free to impact. A culture where everything is possible, where all ideas are taken into consideration, where everyone has an impact on the transformation of insurance! Hungry for freedom? Thirsty for autonomy? If you are adventurous and like challenges, then the Wakam adventure might be made for you!

description_job:
Job Description

Provide scientific review and interpretation of safety data for the preparation of aggregate reports such as Development Safety Reports (DSURs), Periodic Safety Update Reports (PSURs), etc.; this includes the management and monitoring of vendors used to author such documents
Conduct signal detection activities, signal evaluation and risk assessment, and manage the process for the development and management of Risk Management Plans
Work cross-functionally to ensure that Clinical, Franchise, Asset Team and Regulatory objectives are met by reports being submitted according to international regulatory requirements and Company objectives and timelines. Interacts collaboratively and effectively in a team environment (including Safety, Clinical Development, Medical Affairs, Quality, Manufacturing, Clinical Operations and Regulatory), as well as with external colleagues and partners
Understands, interprets, analyses, and clearly presents scientific and medical data in verbal and written format (including intermediate understanding and application of medical concepts and terminology).  
Provide scientific expertise to the preparation of responses to internal and external questions relating to the safety of allocated products; this includes the management and monitoring of external vendors used to author such documents

description_job:
THESE CIFRE - Mod√©lisation a√©ro√©lastique d'une voilure en cas de panne hydraulique (F/H) F/H

Nous recherchons un th√©sard pour le sujet suivant : ¬´ Th√®se CIFRE - Mod√©lisation des cycles limites a√©ro√©lastiques d'une voilure coupl√©e √† une gouverne en cas de panne hydraulique ¬ª

 

Le ph√©nom√®ne de flottement (ou flutter) et plus particuli√®rement les cycles limites (ou LCO) sont des ph√©nom√®nes cruciaux √† prendre en compte lors de la conception d'un a√©ronef.

La r√©alisation de cette th√®se de doctorat en m√©canique des structures, vibrations et a√©ro√©lasticit√© se fera au c≈ìur d'un partenariat entre le service Charges, Vibrations et ACoustique (CVAC) de la Direction Technique A√©rostructure et le d√©partement scientifique DAAA (A√©rodynamique, A√©ro√©lasticit√©, Acoustique) de l'ONERA Ch√¢tillon.

Elle porte donc sur la mod√©lisation du comportement m√©cano-hydraulique des servocommandes de gouvernes en cas de panne hydraulique et son couplage a√©ro√©lastique avec une voilure, dans le but de pr√©dire ces ph√©nom√®nes a√©ro√©lastiques non-lin√©aires pouvant affecter la s√©curit√© de l'avion. Les m√©thodes propos√©es seront d√©velopp√©es et valid√©es gr√¢ce √† un essai en soufflerie r√©alis√© dans un moyen exp√©rimental de l'ONERA.

 

Plus pr√©cis√©ment, les principales √©tapes de la th√®se sont les suivantes :

1. √âtude bibliographique ;

3. D√©finition et r√©alisation d'essais de soufflerie de validation. Synth√®se des comparaisons essais-calculs des diff√©rentes approches num√©riques mises en ≈ìuvre ;

4. R√©daction du m√©moire de th√®se, synth√®se du travail et publications scientifiques ;

 

Au-del√† de la compr√©hension physique des ph√©nom√®nes mis en jeu, la r√©alisation de ces travaux de th√®se exige rigueur, sens critique ainsi qu'une forte aptitude √† comprendre les enjeux de recherche et le contexte industriel sous-jacent.

 

Dans le cadre de ce partenariat CIFRE, les √©changes entre les diff√©rents intervenants (Dassault Direction Technique Aero-Structure, Dassault √âquipements et ONERA) seront multiples et vari√©s afin de mettre √† profit l'expertise de chacun.

 

Les travaux s'effectueront au sein du site de Dassault Aviation de Saint-Cloud et de l'ONERA Ch√¢tillon.

description_cie: ACC‚Äôs mission is to accelerate the transition to sustainable and affordable mobility for all, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions through producing batteries in Europe.
description_job: Join us and be a pioneer for a green transport revolution.Automotive Cells Company (ACC) is one of Europe‚Äôs newest and most exciting high-tech companies.¬†Backed by¬†Saft-Total, Stellantis and Mercedes-Benz,¬†ACC is set to¬†power the future¬†of the automotive industry¬†by innovating in battery technology.¬†We aim to produce sustainable, affordable, high-capacity, longer-life batteries as a¬†cleaner¬†alternative to current energy sources. We have created an R&D¬†center¬†and new state-of-the art facility¬†in Nouvelle Aquitaine, France, and we are building gigafactories in Germany and Italy, in addition to the one already built in Hauts de France.We need a range of¬†skilled and agile people¬†to bring our vision to life,¬†especially in the areas of¬†industrialization, mechanical design, testing/prototyping and any other function of a new-born¬†company. If you‚Äôre looking to take your career further than you imagined, if you‚Äôre passionate¬†about creating cleaner transport, we‚Äôd like to hear from you.Our core Values are : Pioneering Spirit, Fast & Agile, Excellence, Greener & Cleaner !We are also very proud of our 2022 CSR Report : https://www.acc-emotion.com/stories/accs-2022-corporate-sustainability-reportAccelerating sustainable mobility for all.Overall job definition :The HR Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to drive strategic decision-making and support HR initiatives. Use data analysis to improve HR practices, enhance employee experiences, and contribute to the organization's overall success.Main missions :Data Governance :¬∑ Gather, organize, and maintain HR data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.¬∑ Establish robust data management practices and procedures.¬∑ Ensure HR data handling complies with data protection regulations.¬∑ Safeguard the confidentiality and security of sensitive HR data.¬∑ Ensure Bridge with data department.Data Analytics :¬∑ Analyze HR data to extract valuable insights and trends.¬∑ Generate regular and ad-hoc reports, visualizations, and dashboards to aid decision-making.¬∑ Develop and monitor key HR metrics and KPIs to assess the effectiveness of HR processes.¬∑ Contribute to the development of data-driven strategies to improve HR outcomes.¬∑ Provide actionable insights derived from data analysis to support HR initiatives.¬∑ Collaborate with HR teams to make data-informed decisions that enhance HRProcess Improvement:¬∑ Identify opportunities to streamline HR data processes and enhance data quality.¬∑ Collaborate with HR teams to implement process improvements, automation and increase efficiency.¬∑ Provide training and support to HR staff on data-related tools and best practices.¬∑ Share knowledge and insights with colleagues to promote a data-driven HR culture. Knowledge :- Data Analysis Skills- HR Knowledge- Data Management- Project Management- Visualization and Reporting/Experience :At least 2 years (apprentices included)Qualifications:Master of Science in Human Resource Management. Master of Science in Data Science or Analytics. Master of Science in Industrial-Organizational Psychology. French, EnglishKey behaviours :- Critical Thinking - Communication Skills- Attention to Detail- Continuous Learning- Teamwork agility and proactive.Some extra skills which make the difference :PowerBI, SAP SuccessFactors, Experience in IndustryWhy join us?Our Advantages and Perks: new premises, parking spaces reserved for carpoolers, possibility of recharging your electric car on reserved spaces in our parking lot.Other perks and advantages include : Company restaurant, meal and also vegetables/fruits baskets delivery service. description_cie: Dioxycle develops breakthrough technology to produce everyday fuels and chemicals from CO2 shifting from a fossil-based economy to a circular CO2-based economy.
description_job: About Dioxycle Dioxycle is pioneering breakthrough carbon utilization technologies that convert industrial emissions into sustainable chemicals with unprecedented energy and cost efficiency, starting with ethylene, the world's most used petrochemical. By displacing fossil fuels for the production of key chemicals, Dioxycle has the potential to ultimately reduce over 800 million tons of CO2 per year, representing ~2% of the world's emissions. Our team is innovating across chemical, mechanical and system engineering to turn carbon transformation into an economically feasible, industrial reality by developing a completely novel technological approach. Having completed our medium-scale Proof-of-Concept, we are now working towards our first-of-its-kind industrial-scale electrolyzer and are assembling key partnerships for future commercial roll-out. We are supported by world-class funders including Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures and Gigascale Capital and have raised $26M to date. We operate from two centers in Paris and California (so whether you are passionate about outdoors or good food/art scenes, we have a location for you to join!) Your Mission Dioxycle is seeking a dedicated and passionate Data Lead to join our team and play a crucial role in supporting our mission of abating CO2 emissions by turning them into products we use every day. As our Data Lead, you will take responsibilities on the full data stack, including data collection, transformation, the development of data visualization tools and the testing of ML models. For this, you will be working closely with a software developer and another member of the Systems team, with daily interactions with the wider chemistry & engineering R&D team. In this capacity, your responsibilities will center around: - Data engineering: build a state-of the art pipeline to store, access and process the experimental and production data generated by our electrolyzers; - Data analysis & data science: develop data visualization tools to support the R&D team; develop statistical and ML models to extract correlations; implement a technology watch on the usage of AI; - Software engineering: collaborate with our software development team for code reviews and discussion about best development practices. We seek a Data Lead who is dedicated to advancing our mission and possesses the skills outlined below. Candidates with a minimum of five years of relevant experience are encouraged to apply.  Abilities and expertise we are looking for  Highly collaborative, problem solving oriented; Background in maths, physics or chemistry (MsC, PhD or other); Data science expertise: ML, time series analysis and image processing; Data engineering expertise: SQL, python; Full stack web develment experience with Python and React would be a plus, but not a strict requirement Able to work onsite in Paris (Saint-Ouen) full-time (occasional work from home)  Mindset we are looking for  Commitment to the mission and ambition Innovative spirit Determination to deliver on the mission you own, whatever it takes Irreproachable work ethic Anticipation capabilities Radical open-mindedness: no ego. Ideas first  What we have to offer  Impact: We are building a product unique in the world with the potential to radically transform a century-old chemical process to slash emissions at the gigaton scale. Unique journey: We are an early-stage company with a world-class team, offering second-to-none career growth opportunities. People-first: We are no-ego doers focused on self-improving while helping each other grow. International team: We are a uniquely international team with >10 nationalities Top of market compensation packages including Competitive salary, generous Employee Stock Ownership plans, 401(k) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision coverage Ergonomic work stations & state-of-the-art equipment Emphasis on training opportunities Fun: We constantly strive to cultivate a great work atmosphere and organize regular team events.

description_cie: R√©duire l‚Äôimpact environnemental du shipping. AYRO catalyse la d√©carbonation du transport maritime en d√©veloppant et fournissant un syst√®me propulsif √©olien performant nomm√© Oceanwings¬Æ.
description_job: About AYRO AYRO is a French, Deep Tech startup, with the global ambition of enabling the decarbonization of the maritime shipping industry worldwide. We design, build and sell the OceanWings, enabling commercial vessels to reduce their fuel consumption and therefore their CO2 emissions by up to 50% using the power of the wind. By 2050, shipping could represent 15% of all CO2 emissions: the emission reduction potential of our solution could be measured in Gigatons of CO2 in the next 5-10 years. Our OceanWings 363 have recently been installed on the Canop√©e shipping vessel who will transport the Ariane 6 rocket from Europe to Kourou in French Guyana and many other large projects are in the works. Job Overview As part of the performance team in AYRO's Paris office, you will be involved in the performance assessment of Oceanwings and the vessels equipped with them. The aim is to holistically address the impact of a wind propulsion system on a vessel in order to draw conclusions on its economic, ecological and regulatory relevance within a specific operational profile. The evaluation of the measured performance of the Oceanwings will provide input for future optimization of the Oceanwings. If you have a master‚Äôs degree in naval engineering, you have experience in data analysis, you are passionate about technological challenges, you are interested in the maritime sector and are sensitive to environmental issues, this job is for you. Main Missions In cooperation with the Performance Manager and the performance engineers, your missions will include: ¬∑ Development of analysis tools: Continue the development, mostly in Python, of algorithms for processing, analyzing and displaying data collected on board vessels equipped with Oceanwings. ¬∑ Production of performance reports of navigations for internal and client use. ¬∑ Improvement of predictions: Check the predictions against the at-sea measurements and collaborate with simulation and modeling engineers to fine-tune the models for optimal alignment with the measured data  ¬∑ Master degree in Naval (or aeronautical) Engineering, with experience in data analysis. ¬∑ You have a first professional experience in data analysis (1-5 years) ¬∑ Strong skills in applied mathematics. ¬∑ Proficiency in python ¬∑ You have a creative mind, you are autonomous, reliable, curious & dynamic. Very good level of English, and ideally of French

description_job: √Ä PROPOS DE BSF : Cr√©√©e en 2007 par l‚Äôhistorien Patrick Weil, l‚Äôassociation Biblioth√®ques Sans Fronti√®res (BSF) renforce le pouvoir d‚Äôagir des populations vuln√©rables en facilitant l‚Äôacc√®s √† l‚Äôinformation, √† l‚Äô√©ducation et √† la culture. C‚Äôest un formidable outil pour apporter des contenus √©ducatifs et culturels, ludiques et p√©dagogiques, l√† o√π les biblioth√®ques ne sont pas. description_cie: Dioxycle develops breakthrough technology to produce everyday fuels and chemicals from CO2 shifting from a fossil-based economy to a circular CO2-based economy.
description_job: About Dioxycle Dioxycle is pioneering breakthrough carbon utilization technologies that convert industrial emissions into sustainable chemicals with unprecedented energy and cost efficiency, starting with ethylene, the world's most used petrochemical. By displacing fossil fuels for the production of key chemicals, Dioxycle has the potential to ultimately reduce over 800 million tons of CO2 per year, representing ~2% of the world's emissions. Our team is innovating across chemical, mechanical and system engineering to turn carbon transformation into an economically feasible, industrial reality by developing a completely novel technological approach. Having completed our medium-scale Proof-of-Concept, we are now working towards our first-of-its-kind industrial-scale electrolyzer and are assembling key partnerships for future commercial roll-out. We are supported by world-class funders including Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures and Gigascale Capital and have raised $26M to date. We operate from two centers in Paris and California (so whether you are passionate about outdoors or good food/art scenes, we have a location for you to join!) Your Mission Dioxycle is seeking a dedicated and passionate Data Lead to join our team and play a crucial role in supporting our mission of abating CO2 emissions by turning them into products we use every day. As our Data Lead, you will take responsibilities on the full data stack, including data collection, transformation, the development of data visualization tools and the testing of ML models. For this, you will be working closely with a software developer and another member of the Systems team, with daily interactions with the wider chemistry & engineering R&D team. In this capacity, your responsibilities will center around: - Data engineering: build a state-of the art pipeline to store, access and process the experimental and production data generated by our electrolyzers; - Data analysis & data science: develop data visualization tools to support the R&D team; develop statistical and ML models to extract correlations; implement a technology watch on the usage of AI; - Software engineering: collaborate with our software development team for code reviews and discussion about best development practices. We seek a Data Lead who is dedicated to advancing our mission and possesses the skills outlined below. Candidates with a minimum of five years of relevant experience are encouraged to apply.  Abilities and expertise we are looking for  Highly collaborative, problem solving oriented; Background in maths, physics or chemistry (MsC, PhD or other); Data science expertise: ML, time series analysis and image processing; Data engineering expertise: SQL, python; Full stack web develment experience with Python and React would be a plus, but not a strict requirement Able to work onsite in Paris (Saint-Ouen) full-time (occasional work from home)  Mindset we are looking for  Commitment to the mission and ambition Innovative spirit Determination to deliver on the mission you own, whatever it takes Irreproachable work ethic Anticipation capabilities Radical open-mindedness: no ego. Ideas first  What we have to offer  Impact: We are building a product unique in the world with the potential to radically transform a century-old chemical process to slash emissions at the gigaton scale. Unique journey: We are an early-stage company with a world-class team, offering second-to-none career growth opportunities. People-first: We are no-ego doers focused on self-improving while helping each other grow. International team: We are a uniquely international team with >10 nationalities Top of market compensation packages including Competitive salary, generous Employee Stock Ownership plans, 401(k) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision coverage Ergonomic work stations & state-of-the-art equipment Emphasis on training opportunities Fun: We constantly strive to cultivate a great work atmosphere and organize regular team events.
